articles.title: Credentials of Mexican Ambassador to DPRK Accepted
articles.content:
Credentials of Mexican Ambassador to DPRK Accepted
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Mexican Ambassador to the DPRK Martha Ortiz de Rosas at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Mexican Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Mexican Ambassador to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun on Wednesday met and had a talk with Mexican Ambassador to the DPRK Martha Ortiz de Rosas who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Greetings to FM of Bahrain
articles.content:
Greetings to FM of Bahrain
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun on May 23 sent a message of greetings to Seikh Khalid Bin Ahmed Bin Mohamed Al-Khalifa, foreign minister of Bahrain, on the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop more vigorously, the message wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
						
Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Alexander Matsegora and staff members of the Russian embassy here did a friendly work on the DPRK-Russia Friendship Kochang Cooperative Farm in Chollima District, Nampho City on Wednesday.
					They helped farmers in dry field weeding. 
					
					During break, they exchanged conversation with farmers and appreciated an art performance.
					
					They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Lambasted for Provocation
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Lambasted for Provocation
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are indignant with the south Korean regime for its recent provocation against the supreme dignity of the DPRK.
					 An officer of the Korean People's Army, Pak Kwang Chol, told KCNA that those who slander the DPRK's supreme dignity even a bit deserve sever punishment. The south Korean regime of traitors should be well aware that the KPA will never pardon any reckless provocation against the DPRK, he said.
					
					 The manager of the East Pyongyang Thermal Power Station, Jong Myong Su, said the traitor Lee Myung Bak is, indeed, a political illiterate and an immoral fellow utterly uninterested in the destiny of the nation. 
					
					 "The workers of the DPRK, overwhelmed by hatred for the traitors, are determined to wipe out all of them," he added.
					
					 Ho Chun Gum, chairwoman of the Management Board of the Kumdae Co-op Farm in Raknang District, Pyongyang, said if the traitors, who unhesitatingly committed the heinous provocation stunning the entire Korean nation, are left unpunished, the nation would suffer a big misfortune. She called for meting out severe punishment to them persistently seeking confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 Ri Yong Chol, a vice department director of the Pyongyang Municipal Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said millions of young people are willing to become human bombs to annihilate all the traitors to the nation.

articles.title: Seminar Marks Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work
articles.content:
Seminar Marks Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on medical science was held at the Grand People's Study House on Wednesday to mark the 50th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "Public Health Workers Should Be Red Champions of the Party."
					 The work, published on June 7, Juche 50 (1961), clarifies the position and role of health service under socialism, the traits to be possessed of by medical workers, the principles and ways to be maintained in the health service, etc.
					
					 Ri Pong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health, said at the seminar that the work giving perfect answers to all the problems arising in the practice of public health is an important guideline that should be held fast to in developing the Juche-oriented health service to meet the intrinsic demand of the socialist system. He proved the originality of the idea and theory laid down in the work.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il creditably carrying forward the idea and line of the President made it clear that sincerity of medical workers is a vivid expression of the spirit of devoted service for the people, and has led them with warm care, he noted.
					
					 All the health workers should cherish the essence of the President's work and discharge their honorable mission and duty, he stressed.
					
					 Presented to the seminar were papers on the effective therapies and experience gained in treating cardiovascular, endocrine and cancerous and other diseases.
					
					 Attending it were officials, doctors, teachers and researchers in the field of public health.

articles.title: "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" (Enlarged Edition) Off Press
articles.content:
"Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" (Enlarged Edition) Off Press 
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Vol. 9 (enlarged edition) of "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" came off the press in the DPRK.
					The book contains 42 works published by General Secretary Kim Jong Il from April Juche 68 (1979) to March Juche 71 (1982), including speeches, talks and conclusions.
					
					 In his work "On the Juche Idea" he expounded profound ideas and theories through which he systematized and developed in depth the immortal Juche idea in an integral manner.
					
					 In "On Thoroughly Establishing the System of Party Leadership," "On Further Improving Party Ideological Work" and other works he gave lucid answers to theoretical and practical problems concerning party organizational and ideological work and its leadership art. 
					
					 The book also contains works dealing with the Juche-oriented military idea of the Workers' Party of Korea, indicating tasks to be consistently carried out for building revolutionary armed forces and increasing defence capability and principles and ways for implementing the party's economic policy. 
					
					 Such works as "For the Development of Juche-Oriented Literature and Art" deal with principled issues arising in developing the Juche-oriented literature and arts and improving the cultural and emotional life of people.
					
					 Also contained in the book are works that give overall answers to theoretical and practical issues arising in different fields, including the issues of arming the young people with the spirit of uninterrupted revolution, improving the standard of people's living and accomplishing the cause of national reunification and global independence.

articles.title: New Comprehensive Fish Breeding Institute Appears
articles.content:
New Comprehensive Fish Breeding Institute Appears
						
Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A Korean-style comprehensive fish breeding institute has been successfully built in an area on the east coast of the DPRK. It researches into high quality fishes including salmon and breeds and processes them.
					 There are in the institute a comprehensive research centre which specializes in the analysis and research into salmon's propagation, stock, food and processing and a new scientific fish breeding research system. 
					
					 On this basis, the institute has established a system for preserving pure breed for high quality fishes of various species and producing fries while systematically solving scientific and technological issues arising in breeding fishes in freshwater and seawater. 
					
					 It is massively breeding salmon by perfecting the technology of securing fish breeds, producing their food and artificial hatching. 
					
					 The research into fish breeding in natural conditions gained in depth, steadily increasing the economic effectiveness and profitability. 
					
					 It has also successfully solved scientific and technological issues of simultaneously conducting breeding and processing of high quality fishes such as sturgeon, rainbow trout and Ryongjong fish.
					
					 There sprang up a food processing centre where all production processes ranging from raw material feeding to discharge of products are streamlined and a base for the production of high quality protein food containing amino acid and minerals.
					
					 A new fish processing factory with high capacity has gone operational. All its production processes including freezing, washing, smoke-drying, egg-processing, preserving fishes in salt, packing and storage are equipped with latest facilities.

articles.title: Tetron Rayon Production to Be Increased
articles.content:
Tetron Rayon Production to Be Increased
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Textile Mill built a Tetron rayon production process some time ago.
					 The new process does not need a spun yarn process.
					
					 The speed of the water jet loom is much higher than flexible rapier loom and shuttle loom.
					
					 Tetron rayon yarn used in the new process is thinner and more elastic and tensible than Tetron yarn.
					
					 Tetron rayon fabrics treated with reagent and colored and patterned diversely are suitable for shirt and suit materials.

articles.title: Samma Mineral Water Good for Medical Treatment
articles.content:
Samma Mineral Water Good for Medical Treatment
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Many people take Samma mineral water for medical treatment.
					 The water, with magnesium sulphate, calcium and iron as its main ingredients, improves immune function and activates metabolism in human body.
					
					 The water helps prevent and cure various diseases like hypertension, nephritis and heart trouble. It is also efficacious for chronic gastritis, enteritis, colitis and eczema, as well as diabetes and skin itch. 
					
					 Kim Myong Sop, a 50-year-old man living in Taedonggang District, Pyongyang, told KCNA that he had suffered from chronic gastritis for many years but he has been well after beginning to take the water every day.
					
					 The mineral spring is in Tongdaewon District, Pyongyang.

articles.title: Biosphere Sanctuary of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Biosphere Sanctuary of Mt. Paektu
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The biosphere sanctuary of Mt. Paektu covers a vast space extending from the mountain to an area southeast of it.
					Mt. Paektu rises 2,750 meters above the sea level. It is a famous mountain from the ecological, historical and cultural point of view.
					
					 The mountain, formed by a volcanic action, has a peculiar ecosystem.
					
					Korean tiger, deer, musk and other animals live in the mountain. Siberian larch, white birch and other trees, wild vegetables, medicinal herbs, aromatic plants and flowering plants are growing there.
					
					 In particular, thirteen percent of the tundra plants grow in the mountain to attract public interest.
					
					 Char lives in Lake Chon on the mountain.
					
					 Mt. Paektu and its surrounding area were registered as an international biosphere sanctuary in April Juche 78 (1989) as they are of great significance in protecting biodiversity.

articles.title: Shellwork "Native Home in Mt. Paektu Secret Camp"
articles.content:
Shellwork "Native Home in Mt. Paektu Secret Camp"
						
Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The shellwork "Native Home in Mt. Paektu Secret Camp" is a gift presented to General Secretary Kim Jong Il by a Tandong travel company of China to congratulate him on his birthday (February 16).
					 Officials of the company prepared the gift with reverence for the DPRK leader before visiting Pyongyang in February Juche 86 (1997). 
					
					 Seen in the upper part of the craftwork is Kim Jong Il's native home nestling at the foot of Jong Il Peak against the background of a thick forest and blue sky and in the lower part are 55 Kimjongilia blossoms symbolic of his birth anniversary.
					
					 Asking a Korean official to convey the gift to Kim Jong Il, the company's manager said, "We wish the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il a good health. We also hope that socialist construction will go well in Korea under his leadership."

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Miracles Wrought in Huichon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Miracles Wrought in Huichon
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Immortal miracles performed in the construction sites of the Huichon Power Station are a striking demonstration of the validity and the great vitality of Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea. They represent the heroic feats in the era of great surge as they clearly prove before the world that any impregnable fortress can be conquered at a breath if Korea's determination is blended with the revolutionary soldier spirit.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in an editorial:
					
					The immortal feats performed in the construction of the power station are ascribable to the People's Army's full play to their transparent spirit of devotedly carrying through General Secretary Kim Jong Il's instructions as it has shared comradeship with him, a precious fruition of the great unity between the army and the people and a striking demonstration of the great potential of the Juche-based industry and their scientific creative power. 
					
					 Soldier-builders, a-match-for-a hundred soldiers, created the Huichon speed and performed miracles in devotedly implementing the leader's instructions in the construction sites of the Huichon Power Station. They have clearly showed what noble phase their patriotic devotion and the sense of moral obligation cherished by the revolutionary comrades of Kim Jong Il, the descendants of President Kim Il Sung, have reached. 
					
					 The high-pitched drive for a leap forward now under way in the land of Huichon represents the spirit of great surge in socialist Korea where the army and the people of the DPRK achieved unity in idea and struggle on the basis of the revolutionary soldier spirit.
					
					 The builders at the Huichon Power Station created scientific and effective methods of construction unprecedented in the history of building hydropower stations by intensifying the drive for self-reliance by dint of science and technology while looking out over the world while keeping their feet firmly planted on their own land.
					
					They displayed the faith that Korea does what it is determined to do and indomitable mental power while widely introducing advanced science and technology. This was the master key to speeding up the project to the maximum.
					
					 The miracles and innovations performed in the project are brilliant fruition of the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					The editorial calls upon all the officials, party members and other working people to give spurs to the advance for a great surge with the absolute trust in Kim Jong Il and the firm faith that there is nothing impossible for us as it is led by him.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Cooperation with Foreign Forces Blasted
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Cooperation with Foreign Forces Blasted
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The inter-Korean relations have reached such situation that they can be hardly be repaired because the Lee Myung Bak group has desperately worked to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK in league with foreign forces while remaining extremely hostile toward its fellow countrymen. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a by-lined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities' cooperation with foreign forces is a stumbling block lying in the way of achieving the sovereignty of people, act of treachery blocking national reconciliation and unity and increasing the danger of a war against the DPRK and the last-ditch efforts of those who find themselves in the abyss of ruin, forsaken by the nation. 
					
					 The present puppet ruling quarters of south Korea are traitors to the nation as they depend upon foreign forces and cooperate with them without an iota of the sense of independence. The present conservative "government" is a pro-U.S. one installed by the U.S. and a marionette regime acting under its wire-pulling. 
					
					The conservative group has frantically pursued the policy of confrontation with the DPRK, defiling the idea of "By our nation itself" which runs through the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration as "narrow-minded democracy" and "chauvinist nationalism" and persistently sticking to such theory of following foreign forces as "No nukes, opening and 3000 dollars" repudiated and opposed by the whole nation under the signboard of "maintaining its principle."
					
					 The inter-Korean relations have been brought to total collapse and the danger of a nuclear war has reached an extreme phase due to the sycophantic and treacherous moves stepped up by the group while escalating the confrontation with the DPRK in cooperation with foreign forces, its back turned on the compatriots.  
					
					 The conservative group is seeking a way out of its abyss of ruin in cooperation with foreign forces.
					
					 It is nothing but a daydream for the puppet forces to try to do harm to the DPRK through cooperation with foreign forces, concludes the article.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Opt for Redressing its Past Crimes as Early as Possible
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Opt for Redressing its Past Crimes as Early as Possible
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Japan can never evade the responsibility for the hideous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean and Asian peoples in the past no matter what petty trick it may play.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a by-lined article.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to opt for redressing its past crimes at an early date, clearly understanding the anti-Japanese feelings and will of the Korean people.
					
					 Japan is persistently denying and distorting its crime-woven past far from feeling a pang of conscience for its inglorious past issues with guilty conscience. Not content with this, it is impudently shunning the settlement of its past crimes, groundlessly whitewashing and justifying them.
					
					 Whenever the international community is becoming vocal criticizing cunning Japan for refusing to honestly repent of its past wrongs and sincerely implement its commitment to liquidating them, it is employing sleight of hand to paint it as "victim".
					
					 What Japan committed in the past is the hideous crimes perpetrated against humanity which can never be written off no matter how much water may flow under the bridge and no matter how often a generation is replaced by another.
					
					 It is ethics and morality and international usage for a criminal to feel accountable for what it did, repent and atone for it.

articles.title: S. Korea: "Government" Criticized for Swimming against Int'l Trend
articles.content:
S. Korea: "Government" Criticized for Swimming against Int'l Trend
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Hangyore, a newspaper of south Korea, on June 4 carried an editorial slashing at the "government's" stand against the U.S. food aid to the DPRK.
					 Robert King, special envoy for human rights and humanitarian issues of the U.S. Department of State, said at a U.S. House of Representatives Foreign Relations Committee hearing on June 2 that the south Korean "government" does not want the U.S. food aid to the DPRK but the U.S. disagrees with it.
					
					 Recalling this fact, the paper said:
					
					 The European Union, the United Nations and others' movement for food aid has reached a stage where it can no longer be sidestepped.
					
					 The EU planned to finish the field survey till the middle of June and three bodies of the UN conducted a joint survey of the situation.
					
					 The remarks made by the U.S. special envoy that he is making close coordination with several countries meant reaching an international agreement on the basis of such survey.
					
					 How long will the south Korean "government" turn its face away from such trend of the international community?
					
					 It would be well advised to make a switchover in its policy, not sticking to its existing stand.
					
					 The international community is actively coming out for humanitarian food aid to the DPRK. It is shame on us of the same nation to feign ignorance of it.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Calls for Humble Self-Reflection
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Calls for Humble Self-Reflection
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyunghyang paper on June 3 carried an editorial titled "Self-reflection on the policy toward the north is urgent".
					 The disclosure of the secret contact with the north put the south-north relations and, furthermore, the issue of the Korean Peninsula to a completely new phase. The conclusion made by the National Defence Commission in the form of answer by its spokesman on June 1 is that the DPRK would not deal with the Lee Myung Bak "government" any longer.
					
					 Unfortunately, there is no particular card for the "government" at present. This is attributable to the fact that the "government" has put pressure upon the north, focusing everything on the denuclearization of the north with a single mind.
					
					 The same can be said of the fact that south Korea raised the north's apology for the "Cheonan" and Yonphyong Island cases as preconditions for the south-north dialogue.
					
					 What the "government" should preferentially do in this respect is to readjust the environment around south Korea such as humble self-reflection on the policy pursued toward the north so far and censure of those involved. The stand of passing the buck on the north only would just make our stance further shrink.
					
					 Furthermore, south Korea will enter into the phase of presidential election at the end of the year. We are too short of time to shape a new policy toward the north and push it forward.
					
					 An immediate duty of the "government" is, therefore, to manage the present situation in a stable manner on the basis of self-reflection and create a phase of dialogue.
					
					 The "government" should immediately get rid of the shock and comprehensively reexamine the policy toward the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper on Authorities' Irregularities and Corruption
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper on Authorities' Irregularities and Corruption
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Dong-A Ilbo on June 3 carried an editorial deploring the authorities' irregularities and corruption.
					 Lee Myung Bak repeatedly told south Koreans that he would put an end to irregularities and corruption but they have realized that it was an empty talk, the editorial said.
					
					 It is becoming harder to shake off the disgrace as the "corrupt republic" which has been called generation after generation, to say nothing of a "fair society" touted by Lee, it noted, and went on:
					
					 When the people wake up, they can watch another scandal under investigation.
					
					 As proven by the Pusan Savings Bank scandal alone in which Jong Son Thae, director of the Legislation Agency, Un Jin Su, ex-member of the Board of Audit and Inspection, Kim Jong Chang, ex-director of the Finance Inspection Service, Kim Kwang Su, director of the Finance Information and Analysis Service, and others are involved, the number of those suspected of corruption is on the steady increase like creepers of sweet potatoes.
					
					 Words and deeds of the politicians who have patronized the savings bank are investigated here and there.
					
					 The "government" merely repeated call for an end to corruption but has never taken a strong action against it under a specific plan.
					
					 Various inspection organs are riddled with suspected corruption.
					
					 One cannot pin any hope on public servants of this society any longer.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Roll back Their Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Roll back Their Hostile Policy toward DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Council of Christian Churches on June 5 urged the authorities to roll back at once their hostile policy toward the DPRK, south Korean MBC reported.
					 In order to achieve peace on the Korean Peninsula the authorities should make positive efforts to realize dialogue with the DPRK, the organization held.
					
					 The "government" should not block the exchange between NGOs but opt for resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang, it stressed.

articles.title: Actions of S. Korean Students and Citizens to Settle Registration Fee Issue Go on
articles.content:
Actions of S. Korean Students and Citizens to Settle Registration Fee Issue Go on
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- South Korean students and citizens are carrying on their actions to have the registration fee issue settled, south Korean KBS reported.
					 Students affiliated with the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century and citizens held a candlelight rally in Seoul on June 4 and demanded the "government" opt for implementing its commitment to halve the registration fee and settle the issue of youth unemployment.
					
					 At the end of the rally its participants staged a demonstration.
					
					 The fascist police blocked their demonstration and walked off more than 20 demonstrators through merciless repression.
					
					 A candlelight rally was held on June 5, too.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea in a commentary on June 3 accused the hooligans of the "Grand National Party" of their base attitude towards the issue of the university registration fee.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Get Intensive
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Get Intensive 
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are indignant with the south Korean regime for its recent provocation against the supreme dignity of the DPRK.
					 An officer of the Korean People's Army, Pak Kwang Chol, told KCNA that those who slander the DPRK's supreme dignity even a bit deserve sever punishment. The south Korean regime of traitors should be well aware that the KPA will never pardon any reckless provocation against the DPRK, he said.
					
					 The manager of the East Pyongyang Thermal Power Station, Jong Myong Su, said the traitor Lee Myung Bak is, indeed, a political illiterate and an immoral fellow utterly uninterested in the destiny of the nation. 
					
					 "The workers of the DPRK, overwhelmed by hatred for the traitors, are determined to wipe out all of them," he added.
					
					 Ho Chun Gum, chairwoman of the Management Board of the Kumdae Co-op Farm in Raknang District, Pyongyang, said if the traitors, who unhesitatingly committed the heinous provocation stunning the entire Korean nation, are left unpunished, the nation would suffer a big misfortune. She called for meting out severe punishment to them persistently seeking confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 Ri Yong Chol, a vice department director of the Pyongyang Municipal Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said millions of young people are willing to become human bombs to annihilate all the traitors to the nation.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Warned against Slandering DPRK
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Warned against Slandering DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The international community has warned that the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea would face only death and ruin for its frantic moves to do harm to the DPRK.
					 The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy in a joint statement noted that the Lee group is slandering and defiling the DPRK in a bid to divert elsewhere the discontent of the people over the internal contradictions and the worsening poverty in south Korea.
					
					 The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee in a statement branded the Lee clique's attempt to drive south Korea to anti-DPRK confrontation with the backing of the U.S. as an act of threatening peace and stability in not only the Korean Peninsula but also Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The Czech, Moravian, Silesian Trade Unions' Association of the Czech Republic in a statement  said that the situation of the Korean Peninsula is getting tenser day by day and the north-south relations are driven into the brink of war due to the south Korean conservative forces' moves for confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK in an article posted on its Internet homepage warned that the Lee group's moves against the DPRK and reunification would fully reveal its true colors as confrontation maniac and result in its further isolation by the people.
					
					 All the Koreans will certainly settle account with the crimes of the Lee group which has persistently blocked the national reconciliation, unity and reunification through the hideous anti-DPRK moves, the article said.
					
					 The chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain stressed that with the might of Songun the army and people of the DPRK would deal a decisive punishment at the U.S. imperialists and the Lee group of traitors and firmly defend the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK and achieve the cause of national reunification without fail.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Party Leadership Feats Praised by Russian, Nigerian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Party Leadership Feats Praised by Russian, Nigerian Papers
						
Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Russian and Nigerian papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of his work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The Russian paper Patriot No. 21 edited an article with a photo of President Kim Il Sung standing with Kim Jong Il and other photos on his revolutionary activities.
					
					  He published many works, providing the WPK with a theoretical guarantee for correctly and confidently adhering to the socialist line without the slightest vacillation, the article said.
					
					 The Russian paper Nakhodkinski Rabochi on June 3 carried an article titled "Invincible banner for victory" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The article noted that he conducted energetic activities to develop the WPK into the party which had its roots struck deep among the popular masses and enjoys absolute support and trust of the people.
					
					 The WPK led by him will shine long as the banner for the certain victory of the socialist cause, it stressed.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on May 23 carried an article praising his party leadership feats.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle for Reunification Supported by Norwegian Public Figure
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle for Reunification Supported by Norwegian Public Figure
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Torstein Engelskjon, chairman of the Friendship Society Norway-Korea, issued a statement on June 3 on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The north and the south of Korea which had been in the relationship of antagonism and confrontation for more than half a century published the joint declaration, opening an epochal phase of reconciliation, cooperation and reunification. This would be unthinkable without the patriotic efforts of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is a lodestar of Korea's reunification as he ushered in the June 15 era of reunification with his Songun politics and led the implementation of the joint declaration with his energetic leadership.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean anti-reunification forces have disturbed every effort to implement the joint declaration, challenging it.
					
					 But Kim Jong Il took positive steps on his own initiative to ensure that the joint declaration was sincerely implemented.
					
					 He foiled such ceaseless provocations of the U.S. imperialists as blocking cooperation and exchange between the north and the south and driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to a touch-and-go situation and such anti-reunification policy of the Lee Myung Bak group as the north-south confrontation policy, zealously pursuant to them, by enforcing original effective Songun politics.
					
					 We are confident that the Korean people's struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country in the idea of "By our nation itself", the basic spirit of the joint declaration, is sure to triumph and reiterate our invariable support to this struggle.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of His Work at WPK Observed in Mexico
articles.content:
-Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of His Work at WPK Observed in Mexico
						
Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism released its bulletin No. 57 on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il' start of his work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The bulletin carried his portrait and an article titled "Unshakable will, iron faith." 
					
					 The article said:
					
					 The might of the WPK called the organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people would be unthinkable without the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He made sure that the WPK would shine along with the august name of President Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea.
					
					 After the demise of the President, Kim Jong Il published various works, seeing to it that the President was held in high esteem forever, the Juche idea was invariably regarded as the guiding idea of the party and all the issues arising in the party building and activities were settled the way he did.
					
					 Kim Jong Il made sure that the WPK developed to be a guiding force leading the cause of Songun to the road of steady victories.
					
					 He formulated the Songun politics as a basic political mode under socialism and saw to it that it was applied to all fields of the party and state activities late in the last century when the imperialists' anti-socialist offensive was focused on the DPRK.
					
					 He has built up the WPK into the party which is responsible for the destiny of the people, takes warm care of them and forms a harmonious whole with them.

articles.title: Damage by Radiation Increases in Japan
articles.content:
Damage by Radiation Increases in Japan 
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Danger of radiation is getting more serious due to the recent torrential rain that hit the quake-stricken areas including Fukushima Prefecture, Japan. 
					 The Tokyo Electric Power Co. announced that the level of water contaminated by radiation in the building and shaft of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant was rising due to the rain.
					
					 It was reported that the water which  leaked from the reactor into which it had been pumped to cool it and the water was mixed with rainwater, raising the level of the underground water inside nuclear reactor No. 1 about 20 cm in 24 hours by 7:00 a.m. of May 30.
					
					 At a time when the amount of the contaminated water around other buildings that house reactors has increased as compared with that before, TEPCO made it clear that the total amount of water inside the buildings that house reactors Nos. 1 and 3 and in their basements, etc. reached 105,100 tons. 
					
					 As torrential rain is expected in the future, TEPCO expressed concern that radioactive substance mixed with rainwater may flow outside to seriously contaminate seawater and soil. 
					
					 The amount of radioactive substance measured inside the building that houses reactor No. 1 reached 4,000mSv/h at present, a proof that high concentration of radioactive materials are still leaking from the power plant. 
					
					 According to the results of the calculation published by the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry, they confirmed the fact that the amount of radioactive substance contained in the air right after the accident at the power plant reached 770,000 TBq or double that calculated earlier. 
					
					 At a time when there is no prospect of weathering the radiation crisis caused by the accident at the power plant, the south Korean KBS reported that radioactive cesium was detected in the air over some areas south of the Korean Peninsula from May 31 to June 1.
					
					 The damage by killer quakes and the ensuing tsunami is on the steady increase. 
					
					 The Japan National Police Agency said that the death toll increased to 15,365 and those unaccounted for to 8,206 as of June 5.

articles.title: China Attaches Importance to Cooperation with SADC Countries
articles.content:
China Attaches Importance to Cooperation with SADC Countries
						
 Beijing, June 6 (KCNA) -- A China-Southern African Development Community (SADC) business forum was opened in Beijing on June 4. 
					 Chinese Vice-Premier Wang Qishan said at the forum that China will increase imports from member states of SADC so to facilitate stronger mutually-beneficial trade ties.
					
					 Further boosting China-SADC trade cooperation is of great importance for economic growth and the global economic recovery, he said.
					
					 "We are ready to further expand imports from SADC countries, and encourage Chinese enterprises to invest there," he said. "We will offer SADC countries all the help we can to enhance their capability for independent development."

articles.title: Russian PM on Economic Development
articles.content:
Russian PM on Economic Development
						
Moscow, June 6 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin referred to the issue of the nation's economic development at a recent interview with a magazine. 
					 He said that the primary direction for the country's development in the decade to come is to build knowledge-based economy and a high-tech economy with a competitive power and, finally turn economy into a progressive economy and a society-orientated model of development. 
					
					 What is needed for Russia at present is a qualitative index of economy, not its quantitative index and a stable modern economy, he added.

articles.title: Russian Deputy PM on Combat against Terrorism
articles.content:
Russian Deputy PM on Combat against Terrorism
						
 Moscow, June 6 (KCNA) -- Sergei Ivanov, deputy prime minister of Russia, referred to the combat against terrorism at a recent international meeting.  
					 Territorial disputes, extremism, separatism and terrorism pose threats to the world, he said, adding that it is important to closely coordinate the efforts of states in combating them.
					
					  It is the Cold War-minded way of thinking to resort to the settlement of issues by force, he noted.

articles.title: Cambodian PM Calls for High Attention to Children
articles.content:
Cambodian PM Calls for High Attention to Children
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen called for high attention to children on the occasion of the International Children's Day.
					 Children are the backbone of the country in the future generations, he said, adding that the government has vowed to increase interventions in social affairs through the increase of the national budget expenditures on education, health and children welfare improvement programs.

articles.title: Iran's President Lashes Out at West's Hegemonic Policies in Region
articles.content:
Iran's President Lashes Out at West's Hegemonic Policies in Region
 Tehran, June 6 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, speaking at a ceremony on June 3, voiced Tehran's strong opposition to the West's hegemonic policies in the region.
					 He also deplored the West's support for the Zionist regime of Israel in a bid to dominate the Middle East
					
					 "We never change our thoughts and beliefs," he said. He reiterated Tehran's continued resistance against the arrogant powers and illegal actions committed in the region.

articles.title: Israeli Army's Violence against Palestinians
articles.content:
Israeli Army's Violence against Palestinians
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army is committing ceaseless violence against the Palestinians despite the protest and denunciation of the international community.
					 About 40 Palestinians were injured Sunday in Ramallah City of the West Bank during clashes between Israeli forces and Palestinians.
					
					 The Israeli soldiers used tear gas and rubber bullets against Palestinians protesting against Israeli occupation.

articles.title: Ecuador Rejects US Sanctions against Venezuela
articles.content:
Ecuador Rejects US Sanctions against Venezuela
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Ecuadorian President Rafael Correa on June 1 rejected the U.S. sanctions against Venezuelan state-run oil company PDVSA for its trade relations with Iran.
					  "In the name of the national government, I reject the imperialist sanctions of the United States, we reject the sanctions against PDVSA, which is the same to say against Venezuela," Correa told reporters.

articles.title: Worldwide Amount of Carbon Dioxide Emission All Time High
articles.content:
Worldwide Amount of Carbon Dioxide Emission All Time High 
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The amount of carbon dioxide emission, a source of worldwide global warming, is on the steady increase, arousing a serious concern.
					 The worldwide amount of carbon dioxide emission was 30.6 billion tons last year, 1.6 billion tons more than that in the previous year, a recent issue of the British paper Guardian said.
					
					 It was reported that this is an all time high.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Australia, Papua New Guinea
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Australia, Papua New Guinea
						
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A 6.3-magnitude earthquake jolted the western area of an island of Australia on June 5.
					 The epicenter was waters off the area.
					
					 Meanwhile a 5.4-magnitude quake hit New Ireland region, Papua New Guinea on the same day.
					
					 The epicenter was the waters off the Ireland.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajadora Mexicana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajadora mexicana
						
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ATCC) -- Martha Ortiz de Rosas presentó el día 8 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nueva embajadora extraordinaria y plenipotenciaria de Estados Unidos Mexicanos en Corea. 
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departió con la diplomática.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reúne con Martha Ortiz de Rosas
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun se reúne con Martha Ortiz de Rosas
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ATCC) -- El canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun departió el día 8 con la nueva embajadora extraordinaria y plenipotenciaria de Estados Unidos Mexicanos en Corea, Martha Ortiz de Rosas, quien le realizó una visita de cortesía.

articles.title: Entidades extranjeras advierten a la banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Entidades extranjeras advierten a la banda de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ATCC) -- La sociedad internacional advirtió a la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak que con sus maniobras contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea no podrá obtener nada más que la muerte y el arruinamiento.
					El Grupo de Estudio de la Idea Juche y la Asociación de Estudio de la Política de Songun, de Gran Bretaña, en su declaración conjunta, señalaron que la camarilla de Lee Myung Bak denigra e insulta a la RPDC con el designio malintencionado de aliviar el descontento de la población surcoreana por la contradicción interna de la sociedad surcoreana y por la penuria cada día más agravante. 
					
					El Comité de Amistad y Solidaridad Bangladesh-Corea, en su nota, denunció que la banda de Lee amenaza la paz y la estabilidad de la Península Coreana y el resto de Asia y el mundo, llevando al Sur de Corea a la confrontación contra la RPDC bajo el amparo de EE.UU.
					
					La Asociación de Sindicatos de Cechy, Morava y Silesia del Checo, a su vez, condenó que debido a las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC de las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas, la situación de la Península Coreana se torna cada día más tensa y las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas llegan al borde de la guerra. 
					
					El Comité Brasileño de Solidaridad con la RPDC en su artículo online precisó que las maniobras anti-RPDC y anti-reunificación de la banda de Lee Myung Bak muestran claramente su naturaleza de maníaco de enfrentamiento y le aísla desde la población. 
					
					Toda la nación coreana cobrará sin falta el precio merecido de los crímenes de la banda de Lee que impidió cruelmente la reconciliación y la unidad nacionales y la reunificación del país mediante sus maniobras anti-RPDC, aseveró.
					
					El Presidente de la Asociación de Amistad con Corea con sede en España apuntó que el ejército y el pueblo de Corea asestarán con el poderío del Songun el castigo rotundo a los imperialistas norteamericanos y los compinches de la banda de Lee Myung Bak, defenderán con firmeza la soberanía y la dignidad de la RPDC y logrará sin falta la causa de reintegración territorial de la patria.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun se refiere al milagro creado en Huichon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun se refiere al milagro creado en Huichon
						
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ATCC) -- El gran milagro logrado en la construcción de la Central Hidroeléctrica de Huichon pone de pleno manifiesto la justicia y la gran vitalidad de la política de Songun del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y deviene la proeza heroica de la época de gran auge que ha mostrado claramente a todo el mundo que si se unen la decisión de Corea y el espíritu revolucionario de los militares es posible ocupar de una tirada cualquier fortaleza inexpugnable.
					Así señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en el editorial difundido este miércoles y continúa:
					
					La inmortal proeza creada en Huichon es una muestra del firme espíritu de materialización a ultranza del ejército popular que ha formado un mundo camaraderil con el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el noble fruto de la gran unidad entre el ejército y el pueblo y la gran demostración de la enorme potencialidad de la industria del Juche y de la creatividad científica del ejército y el pueblo de Corea.
					
					Los constructores militares de dicha central mostraron patentemente, con la velocidad rapidísima y el espíritu  de materialización a costa de la vida, la fidelidad patriótica y la noble moralidad que tienen la descendencia del Presidente Kim Il Sung y los camaradas revolucionarios del Dirigente.
					
					Los milagros, que ocurren incesantemente en la tierra Huichon, son el espíritu de gran auge de Corea socialista donde el ejército y el pueblo de Corea han combinado la idea y el estilo de lucha a base del espíritu revolucionario de los militares.
					
					Los constructores de la Central Hidroeléctrica de Huichon encendieron la llama de la autoconfianza con la potencia de la ciencia y la técnica ateniéndose a las condiciones reales del país y crearon uno tras otro los científicos y eficientes métodos de obra nunca vistos en la historia de la construcción de centrales hidroeléctricas.
					
					La convicción de que si Corea decide, lo cumple, el indoblegable espíritu, la ciencia y técnica, esto es la llave importante que ha adelantado al máximo la construcción de la central hidroeléctrica de Huichon.
					
					Hoy día, los milagros e innovaciones logrados en la construcción de la citada central se deben a la destacada y probada dirección del Dirigente        Kim Jong Il.
					
					Todos los funcionarios, militantes del partido y trabajadores deben dar acicate a la marcha de gran auge de hoy con la absoluta confianza en el Dirigente y la invencible convicción de que si lo hacen según las instrucciones del Dirigente, no existe en el mundo ninguna cosa irrealizable.
